revised_title: Ridge Fractures in Uniaxial Creep Testpieces: Finite-Element Analysis
tldr: The authors used a large-displacement finite-element analysis to study the deformation and fracture behavior in ridged uniaxial testpieces under constant load. They found that ridges can cause strain inhomogeneities and multiaxial stress fields, leading to errors in strain measurement and material fracture. The study aimed to improve testpiece design and performance by investigating factors responsible for ridge fractures.
